intro: Chromolaena haughtii, commonly known as the Hawaiian chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture and can vary in color from green to reddish-purple. Chromolaena haughtii is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
